description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4pnac","text":"We have developed a new micro-fiber array approach capable of chronically measuring and optogenetically manipulating local dynamics across over 100 targeted locations simultaneously in head-fixed and freely moving mice, enabling investigation of cell-type and neurotransmitter-specific signals over arbitrary 3-D volumes . This protocol includes the micro-CT scanning and fiber localization steps. Please contact us (mwhowe@bu.edu) if you are interested in using this technique. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"uj04","text":"Mice were injected intraperitoneally with 400-500 mg/kg Euthasol (Covetrus Euthanasia III), and then perfused transcardially with 20mL 1% phosphate buffered saline (PBS, Fisher), followed by 20mL 4% paraformaldehyde in 1% PBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5rv08","text":"After perfusion and decapitation, the lower jaw and front of the skull were removed in order to allow diffusion of solution into the brain while still keeping the implant intact.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"803qe","text":"The brain was soaked in the 4% paraformaldehyde solution for 24h, rinsed three times with 1% PBS, and then transferred to a diluted Lugol’s solution, to provide tissue contrast for computerized tomography (CT) scanning (Metscher, 2009).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e5qgv","text":"The Lugol solution was prepared by diluting 10mL 100% Lugol’s Solution (Carolina, 10% potassium iodide, 5% iodine) with 30mL deionized water, a dilution chosen to be approximately isotonic to biological tissues61.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4fjge","text":"Note on soak time: Initially, samples were soaked in this diluted Lugol’s solution in a foil-wrapped 50mL conical centrifuge tube on an orbital shaker plate for 10-14 days. We have more recently found that using 4 oz specimen cups instead of the 50mL conical centrifuge tubes enables better diffusion of the Lugol’s solution, and adequate contrast can be achieved in three to four days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5sh1u","text":"After soaking, the skulls were rinsed three times with 1% PBS, and secured in a modified centrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3gpei","text":"The implanted skulls were imaged in a micro-CT scanner (Zeiss Xradia Versa 520, a core instrument of the Boston University Micro-CT and X-ray Microscopy Imaging Facility) with the following parameters: 140kV, 10W, HE1 filter, 0.4X objective, 2s exposure time, 1001 projections, 12-micron voxel size.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bac21","text":"The CT was then registered to the Allen Mouse Brain Common Coordinate Framework 3D 10-micron reference atlas (Wang et al., 2020) to bring individual mice into a common coordinate system, and then fibers were identified and mapped from the recording tip up to the grid. This process was carried out using a combination of FIJI (https://imagej.net/software/fiji/) and MATLAB (Mathworks, version 2020b) using a combination of existing MATLAB functions and custom\nlab-written functions and GUIs. This pipeline is now publicly available at https://github.com/HoweLab/MultifiberLocalization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":327,"length":33}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"380EF945AF3111EE8CED0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://imagej.net/software/fiji"}}}}
